definition: constable
to catch/to seize/to capture
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
suffix for nouns
head constable

sentences.english: Talking mother, facing Guancha sergeants said good words.
sentences.chinese: 說着母親，對着官差捕頭說好話。

definition: to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
to use public office to avenge private wrongs
to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
Please do as you wish!/You are welcome to do whatever you like!/Please make yourself at home.
spitting anger (idiom); in a rage
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
old: to reap the consequences of one's words (idiom, from Mencius); modern: to go back on one's word/to blow hot and cold/to contradict oneself/inconsistent
to upbraid
a spy/a crafty person
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
to carry out a vendetta against sb
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
sullen/to scowl miserably
man behind the mirror/puppet master/string puller
overbearing/arrogant bully
